explanation:
The current sensor at drive phase A/B/C sensed a current exceeding the user-defined Over-current threshold (0x2006:3 Protection Overcurrent setpoint).
If the user-defined threshold is higher than the hardware protection threshold, as long as the hardware protection is available, this software protection can be considered unfunctional.
remedy:
As the threshold is user-defined, please first check the object 0x2006:3 Overcurrent setpoint to make sure that the threshold is set appropriately.
Regarding an over-current, please refer to the remedy for over-current.

explanation: Indicates that the DC bus voltage is measured below the user-defined threshold (0x2006:1 Protection Undervoltage setpoint) when the drive is in a CiA 402 state that requires high-level power to be applied. These states are Switched on, Operation enabled, Quick stop active and Fault reaction active).
remedy:
As the threshold is user-defined, please first check the object 0x2006:1 Undervoltage setpoint.
Then please refer to the remedy for under-voltage.

explanation: Indicates that the DC bus voltage is measured exceeding the user-defined threshold (0x2006:2 Protection Overvoltage setpoint).
remedy:
As the threshold is user-defined, please first check the object 0x2006:2 Overvoltage setpoint. 
Then please refer to the remedy for over-voltage.

explanation: Indicates a malfunction of the protection circuit.
remedy: Please note down the information regarding the occurence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation.

explanation: A generic hardware fault was detected. In Circulo drives this can be caused by any of the following: phase over-current, under-voltage, over-voltage, over-temperature, shoot-through or watchdog timer.
remedy: Please refer to the Protection hardware remedies for over-current, under-voltage, over-voltage, over-temperature, deadtime phase and watchdog.

explanation: The watchdog is a service, by checking periodically with a timer, guaranteeing that the drive control logic is working in the proper frequency. This error indicates that the watchdog tick is not received on time by the hardware protection, thus the drive is not working properly.
remedy: Please note down the information regarding the occurence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation.

explanation: Deadtime is a common protection strategy in PWM control for avoiding bridge shoot-through, a short-circuit accident caused by transistors on both sides being open at the same time. This error indicates that the effective deadtime is detected below the manufacturer-defined threshold.
remedy: Please note down the information regarding the occurence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation.

explanation: Deadtime is a common protection strategy in PWM control for avoiding bridge shoot-through, a short-circuit accident caused by transistors on both sides being open at the same time. This error indicates that the effective deadtime is detected below the manufacturer-defined threshold.

explanation:
The drive temperature measured close to the power MOSFETs and the DC bus voltage are checked by the same hardware protection circuit against manufacturer-defined thresholds. This error indicates that one or more of over-voltage, under-voltage and over-temperature is/are triggered.
Circulo over-voltage happens at 61.32 V, under-voltage at 13.1 V and over-temperature at 110 ºC.
Node over-voltage happens at 62 V, under-voltage at 9.75 V and over-temperature at 92 ºC.
This error is not reported by Integro.
remedy: Please refer to the remedy for over-voltage, under-voltage and over-temperature.

explanation:
Circulo/Node: Indicate that the phase current or the DC bus current is measured exceeding the manufacturer-defined threshold (referring to the hardware document, link), which triggers the hardware protection circuit.
Integro: Indicate that the phase current or the brake current is measured exceeding the manufacturer-defined threshold, which triggers the hardware protection circuit.
remedy: Please refer to the remedy for over-current.

explanation: Indicate that the brake current is measured exceeding the manufacturer-defined threshold, which triggers the hardware protection circuit.
remedy: Please refer to the remedy for brake over-current.

explanation:
Indicates that the DC bus voltage is measured below the drive internal threshold.
In Node rev. C it should happen when the voltage is lower than 9.75 V.
In Circulo and other Nodes this should not happen because the CPLD protects at a higher level (see PhOvUvOt).
In Integro it should happen when the voltage is lower than 18 V.
remedy: Please refer to the remedy for under-voltage.

explanation:
Indicates that the DC bus voltage is measured above the drive internal threshold. 
In Node rev. C it should happen when the voltage is higher than 62 V.
In Circulo and other Nodes this should not happen because the CPLD protects at a higher level (see PhOvUvOt).
In Integro R1.5 or older it should happen when the voltage is higher than 60 V.
In Integro R1.6 or newer it should happen when the voltage is higher than 65 V.
remedy: Please refer to the remedy for over-voltage.

explanation: Safety module reports a discrepancy between the two STO-SBC input channels. The error will be shown with a 100ms interval.
remedy:
Check and fix the safety inputs wiring accordingly with the assistance of tools for example with multimeter measurement. Compare the measured inputs with 0x2611 (Safety digital input diagnostics) and locate the signal leading to the fault. 
Note that You can only reset the safety fault if you are in the SAFETY ACTIVATED state, meaning both STO-SBC1 (0x2611:1) and STO-SBC2 (0x2611:2) inputs shall be in the Low state when you are trying to clear the fault.
Please refer to the documentation about the safety functions and the STO/SBC inputs wiring of your hardware and check the use of the safety functions in our documentation.

explanation: A safety-based hardware fault detected.
remedy:
Please note down the information regarding the occurence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation. If this fault is permenent and can't be reseted this is a fault caused by broken internal hardware
With the SMM variant from FW 5.1.4 onwards, the SBC fuse or highside switch is damaged. Exchange the drive.

explanation: The SMM missing a validated parameter files.
remedy:
If the case FSoE parametrization is enabled, this warning would be expected until the SMM got the parameters validated from safety PLC via FSoE.
In the case of parametrization by OBLAC drives, download and validate new parameter file to the SMM

explanation: SMM internal fatal failure state
remedy: SMM reported a internal fatal error.

longForm: SMM is missing or is broken
explanation: SMM is not flashed, is missing physically or is broken.
remedy:
Check if SMM flashed with the right firmware. Replace the SMM if damaged. 
This error will be shown if the firmware with SMM support flashed on non-safe devices.

explanation: SMM raised an over-temperature warning due to the too-high measured temperature and crossing the warning threshold (> 105 °C).
remedy: Cool down the system. If the warning persists, exchange the drive.

explanation: Safe digital input 1 reports a discrepancy between the two channels. The error will be shown if Input 1a state is more then 100ms different to the Input 1b state
remedy:
Both channels have to be in the same state, if not this fault is reported.
Check connections on the safe digital input 1. If the error persists exchange the drive.

explanation:
voltage monitoring for external 5V supply for analog input reports a voltage out of the limits
Attention: 5V analog supply is affected by external encoder supply
remedy:
Check analog input connection and meassure voltage on pin 1 on IO port
check connection of other external 5V supplies as all external 5V are supplied by the same power source.
If fault remains when nothing is connected to encoder and IO ports there is an internal HW fault and exchange the drive

explanation: Safe analog input reports an error of getting stuck.

voltage monitoring for external 5V supply for encoders reports a voltage out of the limits

remedy:

check analog input connection and voltage on pin 1 on analog in port

explanation: Encoder monitoring showed an error
remedy:
Either no encoder data is available or there is a mismatch between encoder data of primary and verification encoders.
- try to reset the fault by acknowledging
- Power cycle the drive. If the fault is still there
- on external encoders: check wiring
- check encoder data on non safe side (raw values of encoder 1 and 2).
- check if configuration between of non safe encoder settings and safety parameters are matching
- If the fault appears only after moving the drive:
  - check the gears ratio and encoder resolutions
  - check "allowed position discrepancy" parameter and compare with reported max. position discrepancy. Increase if needed.

explanation: Undervoltage situations lead to a reset of the SMM.
remedy: If the error persists after the power cycle, exchange the drive.

explanation: A parameter download via safe fieldbus is taking place but valid parameters are available.
remedy:
Check and correct parameters on the SMM to enable FSoE parametrization.
This fault is raised if FSoE master downloads safety parameters, but configuration by OBLAC is activated in the drive. If parametrization be FSoE master is used (module with parameters), this mode has to be set as well in the SMM.

explanation: The safe fieldbus stack detected a failure (e.g. checksum mismatch, Watchdog).
remedy: The safe fieldbus stack reports an error. If the error persists after the power cycle, exchange the drive.

explanation: SMM reports internal errors.
remedy: If the error persists after the power, cycle exchange drive.

explanation: One of the encoders might be moving in a different direction than suggested by the parameters.
remedy:
Check and correct gears ratio parameters of encoder monitoring.
if primary and verification encoders run in opposite direction verification scaling numerator has to be negativ

Internal failure happens.

explanation:
One of the bits in the BiSS frame is used to signal error. This bit is set by the encoder and read by the drive according to user-defined parameter (Status bits active value). 
This fault indicate that the drive receives the error bit being active.
remedy:
Please check the 2 cases often seen:
1. Misconfiguration of Status bits active value. The status bits (error bit and warning bit) are by default read as active low, i.e. the error bit being 0 indicates the error being active. Please check the documentation of the encoder and correctly configure the reading.
2. The encoder is indeed rasing an error/ warning. Please check the documentation of the encoder, consult the encoder manufacturer for further investigation.

explanation: The BiSS slave is not acknowledging the request to communicate sent by the drive. This usually happens when there is some issue with the power or communication link, e.g. one of the wires is broken or not well connected.
remedy:
Please firstly make sure that the encoder is connected to the port which is being configured. 
Then check the wiring accoding to the hardware wiring instructions to make sure that, firstly the signals are transfered to the correct pins, secondly the signal transfer is stable. Assistance of measurement tools such as multimeter and oscilloscope is necessary.

explanation: The sensor configuration causes an issue related to the BiSS frame. This error is currently raised only if the BiSS frame size is higher than 64 bits.
remedy:
Please check the sensor configuration according to the documentation of the encoder manufacturer. The most relevant objects to check:
1. Resolution, unit Inc/ Revolution
2. Multiturn resolution, unit number of bits
3. Number of filling bits, unit number of bits

explanation: The BiSS frame contains a CRC6 of some of the data that is being sent. This error is raised when the CRC sent by the BiSS slave is different than the CRC computed by the drive. This usually means that the drive can't read the frame properly.
remedy:
Regarding a CRC error, there are several causes often seen:
1. Misconfiguration of the sensor reading leading to the bits being read wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the sensor configuration according to the documentation of the encoder manufacturer. Common parameters wrongly configured are the singleturn resolution and multiturn resolution.
2. Misconfiguration of the object CRC polynomial (0x2110:15 or 0x2112:15), thus the CRC is calculated wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the polynom in the encoder documentation. The value by default: 67 represents x^6 + x^1 + x^0, which usually doesn't need to be modified.
3. Inconsistency in signal transfer. In this case the fault can sometimes be reset, but would occur under certain circumstances. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise.

explanation: The BiSS frame contains a CRC6 of some of the data that is being sent. This error is raised when the CRC sent by the BiSS slave is different than the CRC computed by the drive. This usually means that the drive can't read the frame properly.
remedy:
Regarding a CRC error, there are several causes often seen:
1. Misconfiguration of the sensor reading leading to the bits being read wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the sensor configuration according to the documentation of the encoder manufacturer. Common parameters wrongly configured are the singleturn resolution and multiturn resolution.
2. Misconfiguration of the object CRC polynomial (0x2110:15 or 0x2112:15), thus the CRC is calculated wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the polynom in the encoder documentation. The value by default: 67 represents x^6 + x^1 + x^0, which usually doesn't need to be modified.
3. Inconsistency in signal transfer. In this case the fault can sometimes be reset, but would occur under certain circumstances. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise.

explanation: Some BiSS encoders require the firmware to read/write some of their registers to be initialized properly. This error is triggered when any of these BiSS register transaction fail.
remedy:
Try to reconfigure the encoder that raised this error. To do so, there are two possibilities:
- Set its function to Disabled and then back to the function it had.
- Remove the encoder from the sensor port list (0x2100) and add it again.

explanation: Some SSI slaves include a ckecksum of the data in the SSI frame. Currently our drives can be configured to read a parity bit from compatible SSI encoders. This error means the parity bit computed by the firmware is different than the one sent by the SSI slave.
remedy:
Regarding a checksum error, there are several causes often seen:
1. Misconfiguration of the sensor leading to the bits being read wrong or the checksum being calculated wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the sensor configuration according to the documentation of the encoder manufacturer.
2. Inconsistency in signal transfer. In this case the fault can sometimes be reset, but would occur under certain circumstances. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise.

explanation: Some SSI slaves include a ckecksum of the data in the SSI frame. Currently our drives can be configured to read a parity bit from compatible SSI encoders. This error means the parity bit computed by the firmware is different than the one sent by the SSI slave.
remedy:
Regarding a checksum error, there are several causes often seen:
1. Misconfiguration of the sensor leading to the bits being read wrong or the checksum being calculated wrong. In this case the fault cannot be reset. Please check the sensor configuration according to the documentation of the encoder manufacturer.
2. Inconsistency in signal transfer. In this case the fault can sometimes be reset, but would occur under certain circumstances. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise.

The number of ticks counted in two successive index pulses is different from the sensor resolution configured by user.
remedy:
There are several causes often seen:
1. The configured resolution is wrong. Please check the Resolution configured according to the encoder datasheet, and please pay attention to the conversion between units (Resolution = Cycles per Revolution * 4). 
2. There's a loss of pulses in encoder reading, which can be due to:
2a. The encoder being improperly mounted, or the encoder ring is damaged. Please check the mounting instruction of your encoder for proper installation, and consult the encoder manufacturer for advices.
2b. Inconsistency in signal transfer. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise. 
2c. The pulses are read with an exceeding frequency. This case rarely happens, but can be possible if the encoder resolution and/or the spin speed being unusually high.

explanation:
For an incremental encoder configured to be with 3 channels (usually known as ABI/ ABZ), the drive is expecting to receive an Index pulse which provides an index for the absolute singleturn position. 
This error indicates that the Index pulse couldn't be detected, while the drive moved the motor in order to detect it.
remedy:
Please first check whether your encoder is indeed with the Index pulse, i.e. is an ABI/ ABZ encoder. If it is an encoder without index, please choose 2-channel (no index) for Number of channels.
Else, most probable causes are:
1. The encoder being improperly mounted, or the encoder ring is damaged. Please check the mounting instruction of your encoder for proper installation, and consult the encoder manufacturer for advices.
2. Inconsistency in signal transfer. Please check the signals received by the drive with an oscilloscope under operation for better investigation. The cause can be that the signal transfer is influenced by external field, or that the signal transfer is unstable for example due to soldering quality or cable aging. Improve the situation by replacing the cables, better arranging the cables, adding shielding, etc., ensuring that the signals can be stably transfered with acceptable noise.

explanation: The hall sensor outputs have an invalid value (111 or 000), or the sequence between the current state and the last state is invalid.
remedy:
Please check the wiring and make sure that the signals are transfered with good consistency.
If the HALL sensor is used together with an incremental encoder for commutation, it can be that the HALL sensor A/B/C pins are connected in a wrong order. Please verify the cabling, and verify the order by running offset detection with only the HALL sensor configured for commutation. If the order is correct, the result of the offset detection should be around 0, and 0x2003:5 Motor phases inverted should show 0 (No).

explanation: This error is raised during the start up of the drive when the battery-based multiturn encoder experienced a total power loss during battery mode. This situation will happen when the battery of the multiturn encoder was removed or experienced a critical voltage drop. Accumulated multiturn count is lost.
remedy: Please check the multiturn documentation and state of the battery. Accumulated multiturn count is lost. The battery has to be replaced and the multiturn encoder has to be re-configured. Referencing procedure for the robot/machine has to be done. In case there is no battery or if the battery is not needed, select "0" or "No" to the "Multiturn resolution" parameter and re-configure this integrated encoder.

explanation: This error is raised during the start up of the drive when the battery-based multiturn encoder detects a battery voltage below the error threshold. This situation would happen when the battery of the multiturn encoder was removed or drained during the battery-based operation. If no Battery Warning was raised previously, then the battery was actively used due tracked motion or a setup was stored for a long time. Accumulated multiturn count is lost.

explanation: This error is raised during the start up of the drive when the battery-based multiturn encoder detects a battery voltage below the warning threshold. The battery has to be immediately replaced in order to avoid losing the accumulated multiturn count.
remedy: Please check the documentation on multiturn battery replacement. If it’s acceptable to perform a referencing procedure for the robot/machine, then a simple battery replacement procedure can be done. Otherwise, a more advanced routine that stores the accumulated multiturn has to be performed.

explanation: This error is raised during the start up of the drive when the battery-based multiturn encoder detects an untraceable fast change of the internally calculated position. Accumulated multiturn count is lost. This could happen due to an actual fast movement during the battery mode, strong vibrations or due to loss of the magnetic field from the encoder pole ring.
remedy: The multiturn encoder has to be re-configured. Referencing procedure for the robot/machine has to be done. Please check if the magnetic ring is installed properly and the single turn encoder is functional. If this happened after the pole ring was rotated in the battery mode, then the encoder internal configuration has to be corrected. Please contact support if the issue persists.

The integrated encoder detected absolute position inconsistency. The encoder system 
may report incorrect (up to 1 magnetic ring pole pair) absolute position at the next 
startup. The current position may be incorrect. If this encoder is used for commutation 
(torque control), the commutation offset may be invalid. Typical reasons are: outdated 
calibration values due to mechanical changes, encoder ring damage.
remedy:
If the encoder was used for commutation (torque control), the Commutation Offset Detection 
procedure should be done first. Next, the encoder configuration and calibration procedures should be performed. If the encoder calibration results look abnormal - check installation tolerances or replace the encoder ring.

explanation:
1. The electrical angle was not completing a whole revolution during offset detection.
2. The calculated commutation angle is out of bounds. A singleturn related configuration parameter (resolution, singleturn) with a wrong value normally causes this error.
3. The motor is not moving during the QEI index detection.
remedy:
Please firstly check whether the motor rotates during offset detection. If it doesn't please check its configuration, wiring, and mechanical mounting.
Please check the encoder configuration, and make sure that while rotating the motor for one full turn, the encoder value is correctly responding to the mechanical position. You can manually rotate the motor for investigation. An alternative way is with OBLAC opening another page and ploting the position feedback of the encoder used for commutation while running offset detection.

explanation:
1. Some encoder parameter was set with an invalid value in the Object dictionary.
2. An action that required a particular encoder function (position, velocity or commutation) was triggered, but there is no encoder configured for that function.
3. There was an issue when trying to initialize or configure an encoder.
remedy:
Please check the configuration of the sensors, especially the parameters changed lately.
Make sure that all functions required (position, velocity, commutation) are configured with the sensors.

explanation: The software configuration is invalid for the hardware. For example, a sensor configured is with a sensor type not supported by that port.
remedy:
Please check the sensor configurations and the digital IO settings, making sure that the setting is supported by your hardware according to the documentation.
This error can be reset even when the configuration is wrong. A good way to check if the error is there or not is to remove an encoder and add it back, or to save the condiguration and power-cycle the drive.

The error is also raised when the multiturn count of such an encoder configured for multiturn is lost.
remedy:

In case there is no battery or if the battery is not needed, select "0" or "No" to the "Multiturn resolution" parameter of this encoder.

longForm: Serial encoder service is skipping cycles
explanation:
The error SkpCycls (0x7303 or 0x7304) is raised when a serial encoder service (REM16, BiSS, SSI, A-Format, MA302) is looping slower than 16 kHz, which means that the cycles are taking longer than 62.5 us. 
The warning SkpCycls (0x7303 or 0x7304) is raised when an encoder that supports 32 kHz sampling (which are only BiSS or SSI) is looping at 16 kHz instead.
remedy:
Minimize the time that is required for reading the encoder. In a BiSS encoder the following approach can be used:
First the clock frequency should be  increased, and then the encoder timeout should be reduced (determine the minimum value from the encoder datasheet). 
For an SSI encoder, only the clock frequency can be increased because the timeout is fixed. 
For other encoders, the speed is fixed. Please contact support if this issue occurs.

The warning SkpCycls (0x7303 or 0x7304) is raised when an encoder that supports 32 kHz sampling (which are only BiSS or SSI) is looping at 16 kHz instead.

For other encoders, the speed is fixed. Please contact support if this issue occurs.

longForm: Encoder sampling period is too long
explanation: This error is raised whenever the Sampling frequency selected in Encoder configuration 1 or Encoder configuration 2 can't be reached.
remedy:
Minimize the time that is required for reading the encoder. In a BiSS encoder the following approach can be used:
First the clock frequency should be  increased, and then the encoder timeout should be reduced (determine the minimum value from the encoder datasheet). 
For an SSI encoder, only the clock frequency can be increased because the timeout is fixed. 
If this doesn't solve the issue, it might be that sampling the encoder takes too long. In that case try reducing the sampling frequency to 16 kHz.
For other encoders, the speed is fixed. Please contact support if this issue occurs.

longForm: Encoder sampling period is too long
explanation: This error is raised whenever the Sampling frequency selected in Encoder configuration 1 or Encoder configuration 2 can't be reached.
remedy:
Minimize the time that is required for reading the encoder. In a BiSS encoder the following approach can be used:
First the clock frequency should be  increased, and then the encoder timeout should be reduced (determine the minimum value from the encoder datasheet). 
For an SSI encoder, only the clock frequency can be increased because the timeout is fixed. 
If this doesn't solve the issue, it might be that sampling the encoder takes too long. In that case try reducing the sampling frequency to 16 kHz.
For other encoders, the speed is fixed. Please contact support if this issue occurs.

explanation: Brake release procedure for pin brake failed, i.e. the configured displacement threshold (0x2004:8 Minimum displacement (pin brake)) is not reached with the configrued torque (0x2004:9 Maximum torque (pin brake)).
remedy:
Please firstly check whether the motor functions correct, for example by manually releasing the brake and running offset detection. If it doesn't please check its configuration, wiring, and mechanical mounting.
While the motor functions correct, please further tune the two configuration parameters, by increasing the torque or decreasing the minimum displacement, until the brake can be released stably.

explanation: Pull brake voltage (0x2004:1 Pull voltage) higher than measured DC bus voltage (0x6079: DC link circuit voltage).
remedy:
Please measure the main power supply voltage supplied to the drive, and check whether the result is close to 0x6079: DC link circuit voltage. Pay attention that the actual voltage supplied to the drive would be slightly lower than the voltage output by the power supply, because of attenuation. 
Check the configuration of the pull/hold voltage, which should be lower than the DC Bus voltage.

explanation: Hold brake voltage (0x2004:2 Hold voltage) higher than measured DC bus voltage (0x6079: DC link circuit voltage).
remedy:
Please measure the main power supply voltage supplied to the drive, and check whether the result is close to 0x6079: DC link circuit voltage. Pay attention that the actual voltage supplied to the drive would be slightly lower than the voltage output by the power supply, because of attenuation. 
Check the configuration of the pull/hold voltage, which should be lower than the DC Bus voltage.

explanation: This warning is triggered when the pin brake release algorithm takes longer than set pull time.
remedy: The pin brake algorithm rotates at 20 Rpm; either increase the pull time (0x2004:03) or reduce the Minimum Displacement parameter (0x2004:08)

explanation: The commutation offset in 0x2001: Commutation angle offset is not valid. This error comes directly from reading object 0x2009:1 Commutation offset: State.
remedy: Please run offset detection before operations. Please pay attention that, the change in some fundamental configuration parameters (sensor configuration, motor configuration) can make the existing offset detection result invalid. Please redo offset detection in that case.

explanation: Requested opmode is not supported. Set a valid value in 0x6060: Modes of operation.
remedy:
Please check our documentation for the available operation modes.
Please check 0x6060: Modes of operation, and make sure that the master controller is sending a correct command.

longForm: Max. current is zero or negative
explanation: User-defined limit on motor max current (0x6073: Max current) is 0.
remedy: Please configure the 0x6073: Max current to be a value larger than 0, according to your motor datasheet or your application need.

longForm: Max. torque is zero or negative
explanation: User-defined limit on motor max current (0x6072: Max torque) is 0.
remedy: Please configure the 0x6072: Max torque to be a value larger than 0, according to your motor datasheet or your application need.

longForm: Max. motor speed is zero or negative
explanation: The value of 0x6080: Max motor speed is 0, so no motion is allowed.
remedy: Please configure 0x6080: Max motor speed to a valid value larger than 0, according to your motor datasheet or your application need.

longForm: Max. power is zero or negative

remedy: Please check the values of 0x6092:1 and 0x6092:2.

explanation: Maximum power limit is active. Torque set point is limited.
Position actual value is out of the following error window.
remedy:
Please check if a motor is blocked, an unreachable profile target is commanded 
or if controller is weakly tuned.

explanation: Velocity actual value is out of the following error window.
remedy:
Please check if a motor is blocked, an unreachable profile target is commanded 
or if controller is weakly tuned.

explanation: Maximum torque limit is active. Target or demand torque is limited.
Max. motor speed limit is active. Target or demand velocity is limited. Also, it is active when Profile velocity in Profile postiion mode is limited.
Software position limit is active. Actual position is limited in order to prevent runaway of a motor.
Software position limit is active. Target position is limited.
Encoder range limit is active. Target position is limited and can't wrap around range limits.
Integral limit is active. Integral part of position or velocity PID controller is limited.
Motor is at the position limit switch and can't move further.
Motor is at the negative limit switch and can't move further.
Actual motor velocity exceeds overspeed protection limit while a controller is enabled.
remedy:
Please check if Overspeed protection limit parameter and Max. motor speed 
are properly configured.

explanation: A communication keep-alive heartbeat was dropped. Check that the PDO messages are being sent by the master cyclically, and within 100 ms of each other.
remedy:
If the inactivity of communication is known/ intended, the occurrence of the error is expected. Do [Fault reset] to clear the fault after the communication is reestablished.
Otherwise, the occurrence of the error indicates that there exists unknown issues in the communication chain. Possible causes include:
- communication delay in master program, check the running status of the master machine.
- disturbance in communication signal transfer, make sure that a communication cable with shielding is used or try with the cable provided by Synapticon, check the stability of cabling.

explanation: A new OS command was sent, but the OS command response of a previous OS command was not read after it completed.
remedy: In order to send another OS command, please read the response of the previous OS command in the object 0x1023:3. Whenever the first byte becomes 0, 1, 2 or 3, a new OS command can be sent.

explanation: I2t protection is active, which limits your maximum torque to the nominal rated values of the motor. See 0x200A: I2t and Stall protection for configuration parameters.
remedy:
Please check 0x200A: I2t and see whether it's configured as expected.
Regarding the I2t being triggered, that indicates that the drive is protecting the motor from potential overheating. Please read our documentation of I2t for more information.

explanation: I2t protection is active, which limits your maximum torque to the nominal rated values of the motor. See 0x200A: I2t and Stall protection for configuration parameters.
remedy:
Please check 0x200A: I2t and see whether it's configured as expected.
Regarding the I2t being triggered, that indicates that the drive is protecting the motor from potential overheating. Please read our documentation of I2t for more information.

explanation: Stall protection is active, which limits your maximum torque to the nominal rated values of the motor or the inverter depening on the selected protection mode. See 0x200A: I2t and Stall protection for configuration options.
remedy: Please check the drive's inverter current ratings and motor rated and max. torque limit. Regarding the Stall protection being triggered, that indicates that the drive is protecting the motor or/and inverter from potential overheating.

explanation: I2t protection is active, which limits your drive's output current to the nominal rated value of the drive.
remedy:
Please check 0x200A: I2t and see whether it's configured as expected.
Regarding the I2t being triggered, that indicates that the drive's inverter is getting too hot. Please read our documentation of I2t for more information.

explanation: I2t protection is active, motor's phase windings are in overheat state and the drive goes into error state in order to protect the motor.
remedy:
Please check 0x200A: I2t and see whether it's configured as expected.
Regarding the I2t being triggered, that indicates that the drive is protecting the motor from potential overheating. Please read our documentation of I2t for more information.

explanation: I2t protection is active, motor's phase windings are in overheat state and the drive limits the current to rated RMS value of motor phase current in order to protect the motor.
remedy:
Please check 0x200A: I2t and see whether it's configured as expected.
Regarding the I2t being triggered, that indicates that the drive is protecting the motor from potential overheating. Please read our documentation of I2t for more information.

explanation: The value of 0x6098: Homing method is invalid or not supported.
remedy:
Please firstly check object 0x6098: Homing method and see whether the object is written as expected.
Please refer to our documentation Homing modes, and check what homing methods are supported.

explanation: The state of the homing switch at the end of the homing routine was unexpected. This can happen if the homing switch deactivates before the axis moves back into the valid range of motion.
remedy: Ensure that the homing switches remain active after the mechanics hit them. Increasing the homing acceleration (0x609A) may help prevent overshoot after the switch is activated.

remedy: Please note down the information regarding the occurence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation.

longForm: Velocity filter cut-off frequency too low
explanation: 0x2021:2 Velocity feedback filter Cutoff frequency is lower than the minimum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2021:2 Velocity feedback filter: Cutoff frequency, and make sure that the cutoff frequency is configured higher than the limit 5 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

longForm: Velocity filter cut-off frequency too high
explanation: 0x2021:2 Velocity feedback filter Cutoff frequency is higher than the maximum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2021:2 Velocity feedback filter: Cutoff frequency, and make sure that the cutoff frequency is configured lower than the limit 2000 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

longForm: Position filter cut-off frequency too low
explanation: 0x2022:2 Position feedback filter Cutoff frequency is lower than the minimum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2022:2 Position feedback filter: Cutoff frequency, and make sure that the cutoff frequency is configured higher than the limit 5 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

longForm: Position filter cut-off frequency too high
explanation: 0x2022:2 Position feedback filter Cutoff frequency is higher than the maximum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2022:2 Position feedback filter: Cutoff frequency, and make sure that the cutoff frequency is configured lower than the limit 2000 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

longForm: Velocity feed forward filter cut-off frequency too low
explanation: 0x2015:2 Velocity feed forward Cutoff frequency is lower than the minimum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2015:2 Velocity feed forward: Cutoff frequency, and make sure that the cutoff frequency is configured higher than the limit 5 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

longForm: Velocity feed forward filter cut-off frequency too high
explanation: 0x2015:2 Velocity feed forward Cutoff frequency is higher than the maximum limit.

longForm: Notch filter center frequency too high
explanation: 0x2023:2 Notch filter Center frequency is higher than the maximum limit.
remedy: Please check 0x2023 Notch filter, and make sure that the center frequency is configured lower than the limit 2000 Hz. Please check the documentation of the object for latest information.

explanation: Invalid configuration was detected for the notch filter.
remedy: Please check 0x2023 Notch filter, and make sure that the rejection band is set smaller than the center frequency.

explanation: The operation to save the config.csv file did not properly complete, and the config.csv may be corrupt. The config.csv file will not be loaded.
remedy: This most likely happened as a result of power cycling the drive directly after issuing a command to save the configuration. A file named "lock" symbolizes that the save operation wasn't completed. If you reconfigure your drive and successfully save the configuration, operation will be restored. You may also upload a known good config.csv file, delete the "lock" file, issue a "restore configuration" command.

longForm: DI for Interlock (Fault Reaction) is low
Motion or drive service is skipping cycles
explanation: The warning SkpCycls (0xF002) is raised when a motion or drive service is looping slower than 4 kHz, which means that the cycles are taking longer than 250 us.
remedy: Try to disable some features (e.g. notch filter or position feedback filters) and see if the problem is fixed.

explanation: This warning is raised when a Somanet control loop is executing slower than 4 kHz, which means that the cycles are taking longer than 250 us.
remedy: Try to disable some features (e.g. notch filter or position feedback filters) and see if the problem is fixed.

explanation:
This fault is triggered when the temperature of the core becomes too high and crosses the error threshold (107 °C for Integro and 105 ºC for the test of the drives). This happens usually because of sustained load on the processor, high operating frequency and even high ambient temperature. High core temperature can lead to equipment damage. 
It can also result in irregular clock timing.
A warning is triggered at 5% less temperature than the error threshold.
remedy: Disable the drive until the temperature is reduced or use external cooling to bring down the over-all temperature.

explanation:
This fault is triggered when the temperature of the drive becomes too high and crosses the error threshold (145 °C for Integro, 90 ºC for Node rev. C and 100 ºC for the rest of the drives). This happens usually because of sustained load on the processor, current leakage from the on-board componenets, high operating frequency and even ambient temperature. High drive temperature can lead to equipment damage.
A warning is triggered at 5% less temperature than the error threshold.
remedy: Disable the drive until the temperature is reduced or use external cooling to bring down the over-all temperature.

longForm: External Scaled Analog Sensor Output exceeded one of the threshold values.
explanation:
This fault is triggered when the scaled external analog sensor output exceeds the upper level threshold or becomes lower than the lower level threshold.
0x2038:11 External scaled measurement Upper error threshold
0x2038:12 External scaled measurement Lower error threshold
remedy: Please make sure that the upper and lower level threshold values are suitable for the sensor you have connected and that the values have been caluclated according to the instructions given in the documentation for scaled measurements.

explanation: Error triggered by OS command 16

This warning or error report says that the virtual braking chopper is actively using the motor to burn energy
- User had configured Virtual braking chopper
- User has configured 0x2010:17 (virtual braking chopper notification level) to report warning or report error.
remedy:
- Check if virtual braking chopper voltage limit is higher than the operating voltage level
- Check if the motor is going to regeneration mode

explanation: Sync time variance of the EtherCAT distributed clock is too high (value will be ignored).This may happen if the distributed clock is poorly configured or the signal isn't consistent.
remedy: Please check the distrubuted clock (DC) setting of your EtherCAT master.

explanation: Drive terminal A is opened. This error can happen if motor cable is not connected to terminal A of the Drive. It can also happen if the Drive is damaged internally.
remedy: Please check the motor wiring, making sure that the motor phase cable is connected to the terminal A/B/C of the Drive.

explanation: Drive terminal B is opened. This error can happen if motor cable is not connected to terminal B of the Drive. It can also happen if the Drive is damaged internally.

explanation: Drive terminal C is opened. This error can happen if motor cable is not connected to terminal C of the Drive. It can also happen if the Drive is damaged internally..
remedy: Please check the motor wiring, making sure that the motor phase cable is connected to the terminal A/B/C of the Drive.

explanation: One of the power electronic switches of Drive is damaged (not conducting). The damaged FET is located in leg A of the inverter, and it is the high-side FET of this leg.
remedy: Please note down the information regarding the occurrence of the error and reach Synapticon technical support for further investigation.
